result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald Dewayne Robinson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronald Dewayne Robinson was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. Pay a fine in the amount of $1,000.00 plus all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharge and any victim surcharges by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. All applicable fees of supervision, this can be through a budget plan. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
- Restitution in the amount of $0.00.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle operated/owned by the defendant

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to BLACK RIVER CORRECTIONAL CENTER ATTN JOC W6898 E STAFFON RD BLACK RIVER FALLS WI 54615
Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP to effectuate change from confinement to extended supervision signed and filed.  File forwarded to Clerk's office for processing.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 19, Judge Cimpl.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (27 pages) PLEA & SENTENCING commencing JULY 29, 2015 received and filed.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $1,578.00 entered as ordered by the court on 08/04/15 to pay $100.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 12/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and filed.  Copies forwarded to Atty Wiechmann and the defendant.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Mayzellar R. and Tunisha P.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  8 YEARS with 42 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.


Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 2 YEARS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 2 YEARS thereafter.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $1,000.00; 
Restitution in the amount of $0.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any victim surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision, this can be through a budget plan.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed.

As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Ronald D Robinson in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Ronald D Robinson in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time.  Court grants FINAL ADJOURNMENT!  Court denies defense motion for bail reduction.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Steven R. Wiechmann in court, defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Case is adjourned to Judge Witkowiak in Branch 22 for Status Conference. Status Conference scheduled for  April 1, 2015 at 08:30am.

Filed. WCS Intixicated Driver Intervention Program dated 3/20/15.

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in custody.  Patrick Anderson for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defendant has picked up a new charge.  Case will adjourn for status in preliminary hearing court to follow the new case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and filed.

Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for plea and sentencing on 01/29/15 at 1:30pm.

Case in court for plea and sentencing, however new defense counsel is requesting more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for plea and sentencing on 11/25/2014 at 1:30pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.  Parties contact to set bail review to address the violation.

Attorney Obernberger must withdraw from case for personal health reasons.  Court appoints Steven Wiechmann as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Wiechmann accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court with attorney Scott David Obernberger.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court with attorney Scott David Obernberger.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for motion hearing.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer John Shipman.  Exhibit 1 received.  Exhibit list received and filed.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion to suppress illegal stop, arrest and search.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program, FILED.

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court with attorney Scott D Obernberger.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, Motion Hearing is adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for 09-05-2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program, FILED.

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court with attorney Scott D Obernberger.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated off the record, defendant's counsel requested adjournment of the motion hearing.  With the approval of all parties, motion hearing adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for 07-02-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Of Motion And Motion To Suppress Evidence -- Illegal Stop, Arrest, And Search, FILED.
In Support Of Motion To Suppress Evidence -- Illegal Stop, Arrest, And Search, FILED.
14RM021312  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:04/18/2014 LJ

Attorney Scott D Obernberger in court, defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail adjusted down to $750.00 CASH BAIL  Motion hearing scheduled for 05-30-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Scott D Obernberger in court, defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson not in court, in custody. Defendant's appearance waived. Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
-  Letter from Department of Veteran Affairs, FILED.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail ADJUSTED DOWN TO $750.00 CASH BAIL with TURNOVER to WCS for immediate transportation to VA Hospital for intreatment program.  Court GRANTS Modification of Bail with the understanding that if defendant leaves the hospital without the Court's authorization, and upon advisement of same from the VA Hospital, a warrant will be issued for defendant's arrest.   Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety, participate with drug testing by the VA Hospital and by WCS if appropriate.  Defendant is to participate in the SCRAM Program if appropriate.  If WCS and the VA Hospital deems it appropriate, the defendant is to be monitored by WCS upon release from intreatment program.

Motion Hearing to Challenge Stop and Probable Cause scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Motions are to be filed with this court by 05-15-2014.   

  Motion hearing scheduled for 05-30-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court with attorney Scott David Obernberger.  Sara Schroeder for Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
sDefendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin State Public Defender Eligibility Evaluation Form, FILED.
With same terms and conditions as previously set on 03-08-2014.

Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail adjusted down to $6,000.00 CASH BAIL BOND with all previous terms and conditions remaining in place.  If Defense Counsel finds that opening for Inpatient Treatment is/becomes available, Court would reconsider the bail, after review of Treatment Records to determine if previous treatment took place with said treatment center and results of same.  Preliminary Court Clerk contacted for Preliminary Hearing Date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-03-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court with attorney Scott David Obernberger.  Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Scott Obernberger to represent the defendant; Attorney Obernberger to be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate per payment schedule to be determined.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept.  Order signed and filed.  Attorney Obernberger appears in this Court, meets with defendant off the record and represents defendant during the bail bond hearing held.

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant appears without counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.   Defendant is requesting bail be addressed on the next scheduled court appearance date.  
  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.  No driving without a valid license.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 2.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
AODA Assessment Form placed in Court File.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
